result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam E. Kittel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/full time schooling and when not fully engaged, must complete 15 hours community service per week.

Counseling as recommended.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/H- 4 years probation on each count, concurrent. CONDITIONS: 44 days time served MCJ, I/S 120 days MCJ on Ct. 1 in 15CF130, Absolute Sobriety from drugs, AODA and follow up, counseling as recommended, Full time work/Full time schooling and when not fully engaged, must complete 15 hours Community Service a week, Restitution of $200 to B.K., $151.50 to Pawn America, $202.50 to Downtown Pawn and to be paid back at the rate of $15/month when on probation. Court Costs. COURT finds 44 days jail credit. 2 DNA Surcharges-Remits Surcharge on 15CF153.
